factsheet.heading: The house
paragraphs: With historic Lavender Pond at the doorstep of the house and the river Thames around the corner, this house has been designed around the urban realms it sits in. With vistas created for light and tranquility, it sits surrounded by nature, but bang in the middle of London docklands. The house is designed with clean scandi lines, as an ode to minimalism and functionality. Petite and gorgeous!

factsheet.heading: The Neighbourhood
paragraphs: The house, situated on the former Lavender Dock, is nestled between the City and watched over by Canary Wharf. Arriving on the Thames clipper via Nelson Dock Pier or the overground that comes via the nearby Brunel Tunnel, the house is at a confluence of historically significant transport for London. At nearby Surrey Dock Farm see farm animals juxtaposed with the skyscrapers of Canary Wharf.
Come with a  little bit of extra time, you will get a local map where you can explore some historic nuggets of the immediate neighborhood.

factsheet.heading: The body
paragraphs: This 1980's house was completely gutted with a ground floor extension, a loft and a porch.  The stairs were also relocated. With Lavender Pond behind you, walk over a small gravel front garden up as you catch glimpses of the inside of the house through bamboo and a large picture window up front.

A functional open plan living, dining, kitchen flows into the outside lounge garden and is backed by a wall of green with tall tress with sports pitches to the rear: welcome to an oasis in the middle of London.

From all windows to the front, you see an imposing view of Canary Wharf skyscrapers rising proudly above the tree tops and rooflines. As you ascend to the top suite, you are flooded with light from the skylight. A thoughtfully designed bathroom provides a shower with a view! The top suite also have a walk in closet and a Juliet balcony overlooking the trees.
